Fusion 360 Share Link: https://a360.co/2H4439W
Project video https://youtu.be/bbsD-3_AP_0
3D Hangouts https://youtu.be/AJ9JT_pHqAw
Layer by Layer https://youtu.be/Yrz57TUeFzI

When working with 3D printed parts, a press can help you install inserts. This holds a soldering iron vertically and allows you to press down, perfectly straight. The tip of the iron heats up the brass and softens the plastic. Pressing down pushes the insert into the part and once it cools down, it’s locked in place. This could be handy for folks doing a small production run or if you're looking for a tool to make this easier.

This rig makes installing inserts feel like pressing a hot knife through butter – The linear motion on this build feels smooth. This is definitely over engineered and we spent way too much time on it but we think folks will find it useful. The rig is modular and uses common hardware – The 3d printed parts can be remixed and modified to work with other components. There’s a learn guide for this project so folks can build their own.

Holding the iron straight seems simple enough and works fine most of the time but the conical shape of a regular soldering iron tip can catch the insert and accidentally pull it out while melting the plastic – And that can sometimes ruin parts.

Soldering Iron 60W
https://www.adafruit.com/product/3685

Heat-Set Installation Tips
https://www.adafruit.com/product/4239

2020 Aluminum Extrusion
https://www.adafruit.com/product/1221

M4 button head screws
https://www.adafruit.com/product/1160

M4 Slim T-Nuts
https://www.adafruit.com/product/1157

Stickvise PCB vise
https://www.adafruit.com/product/3197

Soldering Tips for Heat Set Inserts
https://www.adafruit.com/product/4239

Inventor II 3D Printer
https://www.adafruit.com/product/3897

Filament for 3D Printers
https://www.adafruit.com/product/2080
details:
Summary

In this project we're building a rig for installing heat set inserts. Use 3D printed parts and hardware to build a solder rig with smooth linear roller action! Make perfectly straight inserts with precision using a tip for installing inserts.

Learn guide: https://learn.adafruit.com/heat-set-rig/
Fusion 360 Share Link: https://a360.co/2H4439W
Project video https://youtu.be/bbsD-3_AP_0
3D Hangouts https://youtu.be/AJ9JT_pHqAw
Layer by Layer https://youtu.be/Yrz57TUeFzI

When working with 3D printed parts, a press can help you install inserts. This holds a soldering iron vertically and allows you to press down, perfectly straight. The tip of the iron heats up the brass and softens the plastic. Pressing down pushes the insert into the part and once it cools down, it’s locked in place. This could be handy for folks doing a small production run or if you're looking for a tool to make this easier.

This rig makes installing inserts feel like pressing a hot knife through butter – The linear motion on this build feels smooth. This is definitely over engineered and we spent way too much time on it but we think folks will find it useful. The rig is modular and uses common hardware – The 3d printed parts can be remixed and modified to work with other components. There’s a learn guide for this project so folks can build their own.

Holding the iron straight seems simple enough and works fine most of the time but the conical shape of a regular soldering iron tip can catch the insert and accidentally pull it out while melting the plastic – And that can sometimes ruin parts.

Soldering Iron 60W
https://www.adafruit.com/product/3685

Heat-Set Installation Tips
https://www.adafruit.com/product/4239

2020 Aluminum Extrusion
https://www.adafruit.com/product/1221

M4 button head screws
https://www.adafruit.com/product/1160

M4 Slim T-Nuts
https://www.adafruit.com/product/1157

Stickvise PCB vise
https://www.adafruit.com/product/3197

Soldering Tips for Heat Set Inserts
https://www.adafruit.com/product/4239

Inventor II 3D Printer
https://www.adafruit.com/product/3897

Filament for 3D Printers
https://www.adafruit.com/product/2080

Brass Threaded Inserts

Threaded inserts are great for making bolted connections when securing parts together.
Adding metal threads to your parts will significantly increase the durability.
You can also loosen the connection and take it apart without wearing out the threads.

The knurling on the outside of these brass inserts are design for heat setting plastic.
A tip specifically designed for installing inserts works better than regular soldering tips.
These are compatible with irons that use internal ceramic heaters like Hakko’s and Weller’s. The longer shank reaches deeper into parts and tight corners without touching plastic.

Custom Section

How It Works

            <div><p><strong><em>Update: Added STEP and F3Z file formats</em></strong><br>

The build uses 2020 aluminum and a roller carriage – It’s got ball bearings and wheels to go up and down the piece of 2020. It’s counter weighted so it’s effortless to press down and lift. There’s a pulley and idler at the top for paracord to loop around a ball bearing.

The soldering iron is clamped to an arm and bolted to the roller carriage.

A T-Nut acts as an end stop and prevents the tip of the iron from hitting the platform.

The platform itself is a piece of wood with the 2020 secured to a 3d printed bracket.

This makes heat sets so much more precise and gives perfectly straight results every time.

So if you’re making lots of parts and need to streamline your production, this might work for you.

name: PyBadge Case
description:
In this project we’re making a case for the Adafruit PyBadge. This 3d printed case is designed for a lanyard so you can use it as a conference badge. 

The case is 3d printed in translucent PLA and does not require any support material. A little actuator fits inside the case so you can easily trigger the reset button. The PCB press fits nicely and doesn’t require any hardware screws. The top cover features cutouts for the display and all the buttons.

Learn Guide:
https://learn.adafruit.com/pybadge-case/

YouTube Video:
https://youtu.be/rTxf4x6bQPc

MakeCode Arcade

MakeCode Arcade is a block based editor for programming your own games. It’s designed for beginners and features tutorials so you can customize them or build your own. The built-in tools like the sprite editor, lets you to easily create assets and animations.

The Adafruit PyBadge pairs with MakeCode so you can program and upload yours games over USB. With MakeCode Arcade you can built platforms, side-scrollers, shooters and puzzle type games.

https://arcade.makecode.com

Filament:

 Fillamentum PLA 
                Starlight, Rapzunel Silver, Gold Happens, Vertigo Galaxy

                    <br>                        <p class="detail-setting notes"><strong>Notes: </strong>
                    </p><div><p>Use a brim where necessary. First, print out the tester-tube.stl twice and see how well they screw together – Adjust slice settings as necessary.</p></div>

How I Designed This

            <p class="detail-caption"><strong>Spin me right round.</strong></p>

Blade Assembly

            <p class="detail-caption"><strong>Tubular</strong></p>

Handle Assembly

            <p class="detail-caption"><strong>Clampy clamp</strong></p>

Parametric Customization

                <p class="detail-title"><strong>User Parameters</strong></p>
            <div><p>Need to change the diameter of the screw? How about using different heat set inserts? The parts are setup with user parameters, so it's easy to change a value and automatically update the features in CAD. Tolerances use a "gap" to give clearance between mating surfaces – slight adjustments make big differences.</p></div>

data.notes: Use a brim where necessary. First, print out the tester-tube.stl twice and see how well they screw together – Adjust slice settings as necessary.

data.title: User Parameters
data.content: Need to change the diameter of the screw? How about using different heat set inserts? The parts are setup with user parameters, so it's easy to change a value and automatically update the features in CAD. Tolerances use a "gap" to give clearance between mating surfaces – slight adjustments make big differences.

name: PyPortal Wall Mount
description:
***New Update March 25, 2019*** Outlet version added

https://youtu.be/vZ4_DNBfy4c
This is a 3D printed wall mount for the PyPortal. The two part design features a hanging setup so it can be docked and undock. The mounting bracket can be attached to an existing light switch plate. We think this will be nice for IoT projects that need to be stationary.

Source files and documentation:
https://learn.adafruit.com/pyportal-wall-mount

Say hello to PyPortal! The easiest way to build your IoT projects with a touchscreen display! Make sure to walk through the PyPortal introduction guide and walkthrough the pages. It'll get you setup with Circuit Python and a handful of demo code to play with!

Get Adafruit PyPortal
https://www.adafruit.com/product/4116
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9meeVehRS6A

name: Star Trek Alarm Clock - Adafruit PyPortal
description:
https://youtu.be/i-coZnJzuD4
Guide: https://learn.adafruit.com/pyportal-alarm-clock

Fusion 360 Share Link:
https://a360.co/2TYCIyy

In this project we’re building an IoT Alarm Clock using Adafruit’s PyPortal.

This displays the time and weather using custom fonts and icons.

The device features a built-in snooze button and the alarm triggers sound effects.

You can set the alarm by tapping buttons on the screen and use the UI to either turn it on or off.

Connections on the back feature USB ports for charging the built-in lipo battery and an extra device. So you can plug in a USB cable and charge your phone maybe on your night stand!

Get Adafruit PyPortal
https://adafru.it/4116

Adafruit PowerBoost 1000C
https://adafru.it/2465

Speaker
https://adafru.it/3968

Arcade Button
https://adafru.it/471

2500mAh battery
https://adafru.it/328

USB wall adapter
https://adafru.it/1995
description_html:
https://youtu.be/i-coZnJzuD4
Guide: https://learn.adafruit.com/pyportal-alarm-clock

Fusion 360 Share Link:
https://a360.co/2TYCIyy

In this project we’re building an IoT Alarm Clock using Adafruit’s PyPortal.

This displays the time and weather using custom fonts and icons.

The device features a built-in snooze button and the alarm triggers sound effects.

You can set the alarm by tapping buttons on the screen and use the UI to either turn it on or off.

Connections on the back feature USB ports for charging the built-in lipo battery and an extra device. So you can plug in a USB cable and charge your phone maybe on your night stand!

Get Adafruit PyPortal
https://adafru.it/4116

Adafruit PowerBoost 1000C
https://adafru.it/2465

Speaker
https://adafru.it/3968

Arcade Button
https://adafru.it/471

2500mAh battery
https://adafru.it/328

USB wall adapter
https://adafru.it/1995

details:
Summary

Build a Keyblade inspired prop with lights and sound effects using Prop-Maker FeatherWing! 3D print the parts and use circuit python to program the Feather M4 Express and NeoPixel LEDs.

Project video on YouTube
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ae5X_SgtCOQ

Learn guide
https://learn.adafruit.com/propmaker-keyblade/

Adafruit Feather M4 Express
https://www.adafruit.com/product/3857

Adafruit Prop Maker FeatherWing
https://www.adafruit.com/product/3988

16x NeoPixel Ring
https://www.adafruit.com/product/1463

144/m NeoPixel Strip
https://www.adafruit.com/product/1507

40mm Speaker
https://www.adafruit.com/product/3968

2200mAh battery
https://www.adafruit.com/product/1781

Mini Panel Mounted Toggle Switch
https://www.adafruit.com/product/3221

3D Parts Library on GitHub
https://github.com/adafruit/Adafruit_CAD_Parts

3D Printing Projects Playlist:
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLjF7R1fz_OOWD2dJNRIN46uhMCWvNOlbG

3D Hangout Show Playlist:
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLjF7R1fz_OOVgpmWevin2slopw_A3-A8Y

Layer by Layer CAD Tutorials Playlist:
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLjF7R1fz_OOVsMp6nKnpjsXSQ45nxfORb

Timelapse Tuesday Playlist:
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLjF7R1fz_OOVagy3CktXsAAs4b153xpp_

How I Designed This

I designed this to be modular so parts snap fit together. This makes it easy to take apart so it’s ready for transport. The handle and pipes connect with screw-threaded ends. The electronics are easy to get to so the battery can easily be recharged or the code updated over USB. The blade is also detachable so it's easy to break it down and put it up for storage.

This utilizes dual extrusion to create multi-colored elements that are printed using glitter infused filament. Parts printed with transparent PLA will diffuse the LEDs to illuminate specific features throughout the build. It's designed to house all of the electronics. This design was inspired by Dave Lunar’s Iron Warrior Battle Axe - It’s a take on a space marines weapon from warhammer 40k world. https://grabcad.com/library/warhammer-40000-chain-axe-1

name: Robotic Creatures
description:
In this project we'll show you how to bring creatures to life using magnetic filament and magnets, powered by a Circuit Playground Express and Crickit, Adafruit's robotics platform! The enclosure houses the electronics and the models are printed in Magnetic PLA. Adafruit’s Crickit and Circuit Playground Express have everything you need to build a project with lights, sounds, and motor control.

Learn Guide: https://learn.adafruit.com/robotic-creatures/overview
Project Video: https://youtu.be/QJ8ITURT0NU

These magnetic creatures come to life when placed close to the platform. Here a motor and magnet move the creatures around the platform. NeoPixel UV LED help illuminate the dual translucent material!

The print in place hinges bring these 3d printed creatures to life!

Adafruit Crickit
https://www.adafruit.com/product/3093

Adafruit Circuit Playground Express
https://www.adafruit.com/product/3333

UV NeoPixel Strip
https://www.adafruit.com/product/3851

DC motor in Servo Body
https://www.adafruit.com/product/2941

ProtoPasta Magnetic Iron PLA
https://www.adafruit.com/product/3753

Magnets
https://www.adafruit.com/product/9

3D Printing Projects Playlist:
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLjF7R1fz_OOWD2dJNRIN46uhMCWvNOlbG

3D Hangout Show Playlist:
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLjF7R1fz_OOVgpmWevin2slopw_A3-A8Y

Layer by Layer CAD Tutorials Playlist:
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLjF7R1fz_OOVsMp6nKnpjsXSQ45nxfORb

Timelapse Tuesday Playlist:
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLjF7R1fz_OOVagy3CktXsAAs4b153xpp_

Timelapse Tuesday Playlist:
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLjF7R1fz_OOVagy3CktXsAAs4b153xpp_

Print Settings

Printer Brand:

FlashForge

                                            <p class="detail-setting printer"><strong>Printer: </strong>
                     <div><p>Inventor II</p></div>

Rafts:

No

                                            <p class="detail-setting supports"><strong>Supports: </strong>
                     <div><p>No</p></div>

Resolution:

0.20mm

                                            <p class="detail-setting infill"><strong>Infill: </strong>
                     <div><p>20</p></div>


Filament:

Proto-Pasta Magnetic Iron PLA 
                Gray

                    <br>                        <p class="detail-setting notes"><strong>Notes: </strong>
                    </p><div><p>Slice Settings<br>

Depending on your 3D printer, you may need to adjust the slice settings. We printed all of the parts on an Inventor II 3D Printer. These parts were sliced with FlashPrint.

Nozzle: 0.4mm
Extrusion Width: 0.4mm
Layer Height: 0.2mm
Infill: 20%
Nozzle Temperature: 210c
Print Speed: 60mm/s

How I Designed This

Edit Design

The design is modeled in Autodesk Fusion 360 and available to edit. You can adjust the pieces to print by moving or adding construction planes to cut up the parts . You can modify the sketches or adjust features in the parametric timeline.

Design Source Files
The enclosure assembly was designed in Fusion 360. This can be downloaded in different formats like STEP, SAT and more. Electronic components like the board, displays, connectors and more can be downloaded from our Fusion 360 CAD parts github repo.

https://github.com/adafruit/Adafruit_CAD_Parts

Print-In-Place Critters

Print Creatures

We used Magnetic Iron Filament to print our creatures. Objects with print in place hinges that move side to side vertically, maneuver the best around the platform. You can find download links to the models we used in this project below.

Fish Fossilz by Murray Clark: https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:1276095

Mini Octopus by Javi Rodríguez: https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:3495390

Flexible Starfish by Yong Joo Kim : https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:3258092

Custom Section

data.title: Print Creatures
data.content:
We used Magnetic Iron Filament to print our creatures. Objects with print in place hinges that move side to side vertically, maneuver the best around the platform. You can find download links to the models we used in this project below.

Fish Fossilz by Murray Clark: https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:1276095

Mini Octopus by Javi Rodríguez: https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:3495390

Flexible Starfish by Yong Joo Kim : https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:3258092

name: PyPortal Case
description:
3D print a case for the Adafruit PyPortal! Build a portable IoT project using Adafruit's PyPortal and PowerBoost. Get started with circuit python and program hardware with a touch screen display! 

The enclosure features snap fit covers and a bracket for securing all the components. Secure the PCBs to the 3D printed case with machine screws. The back cover snap fits and features a spot for a bigger speaker. There’s also a nice cut out for the micro SD card slot. You can use a toggle switch to power the device on and off. You can also recharge the lipo battery over USB. The face plates can be swapped out so you can build a custom keypad.

https://youtu.be/KYEBMq09bWA

Learn guide, documentation, code:
https://learn.adafruit.com/pyportal-case/
https://learn.adafruit.com/adafruit-pyportal

Get Adafruit PyPortal https://adafru.it/4116

Adafruit PowerBoost 1000C
https://www.adafruit.com/product/2465

Mini Oval Battery
https://www.adafruit.com/product/3923

1200mAh lipo battery
https://www.adafruit.com/product/258

Panel Mounted Switch
https://www.adafruit.com/product/3221

name: Geodesic Lamp Shade
description:
https://youtu.be/PR1VPX4kCZE
Inspired by geodesic domes this lamp shade is dual extruded in translucent PLA and dark colored PLA. The wireframe structure protects a thin shelled transparent core and fuses together at the top. Two different sizes are available. 140mm diameter and 220mm diameter both with an opening at the bottom for an E26 standard or medium light bulb socket base.

3D printed using an Ultimaker 3 with no supports, ooze shield, or prime towers.

name: HalloWing Mac M0
description:
Build a mini mac with HalloWing that displays boot screen actually plays startup chimes! It uses the Adafruit HalloWing M0 Express and runs Circuit Python. The capacitive touch pads cycling through images and sounds stored on device. Circuit Python makes it easy to display images on TFT displays. The HalloWing PCB snap fits onto the face plate without any screws. A mini speaker plugs into the audio port on the back. Press fit the speaker into the back door and close it shut with the built-in latch. You can power the HalloWing over USB or recharge a lipo battery to make it portable.
https://youtu.be/0-uyLHNdH5E
Files, code, learn guide: https://learn.adafruit.com/hallowing-mac/

Adafruit HalloWing M0 Express
https://www.adafruit.com/product/3900

Mini Oval Speaker
https://www.adafruit.com/product/3923

Circuit Python on Hardware
https://www.adafruit.com/circuitpython

name: Crickit Light Switch Servo Mount
description:
Send Bluetooth Low Energy commands to a Feather nRF5280 Express and Crickit FeatherWing running CircuitPython, then the servo motor will flick on and off the light switch with a 3D printed arm. No mains AC wiring required, the switch is flipped through entirely mechanical means! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nlrCnM1yzL0

From John Park's Workshop, Learn Guide coming soon!

The mount and servo arm are remixed from [Smart light switch with a servo](https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:2848069) and combined with [Mount for CRICKIT](https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:2998716)

[example link](http://example.com/)

name: Microscope Stand
description:
Microscope Stand

A few years ago I bought a microscope, but its stand was so uncomfortable that for a long time it was lying idle on the shelf. And now I need ... And that's what I decided to do ...

See the video for details:

Digital Microscope - http://ali.pub/329tle

Links to used tools:

  • Trimming knife - http://ali.pub/329two
  • B7000 Glue - http://ali.pub/329u58
  • Insert Nuts M4 - http://ali.pub/2z2o7f
  • Acrylic adhesive Tape - http://ali.pub/329v5e

name: Stand Press. 2 in 1
description:
Stand Press

2 in 1 For Heat Set nut Insert and Mini Drill

Model mini-drill will do later. I ordered mini-chucks for drill and flanged bearings, they are still on the way. This will be a drill with a spindle, where the load will not apply to the motor. There will also be an electronic automatic speed controller.

Details of the assembly, see the video

For Mini Drill:

  • Mini Chuck - http://ali.pub/2z2nwx
  • Collet Drill - http://ali.pub/2z2nyv
  • Bearing F693ZZ - http://ali.pub/2z2o1l
  • Insert Nuts M4*4 OD=4.2 - https://goo.gl/UfUmF7
  • Insert Nuts M2 M2.5 M3 - http://ali.pub/2z2odu Buy & save with CashBack - http://ali.pub/2v0znm
Aluminum anodized tubes: diameter 10mm length 200mm, diameter 6mm length 120mm

My favorites:

Thank you for every tip or donation,
it means great recognition for me and helps a lot to keep going!

name: Broken Clamp Repair
description:
Broken Clamp Repair

This clamp detail often breaks. The idea was suggested to me by the author of this model https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:3052609, but having studied in detail, I realized that it would not suit me. Therefore, I made my own version.

There are two versions in the archive for 4 and 6 inch clamps.

See the video for details:

In China such clamps can be bought for a couple of bucks ( https://goo.gl/1zTzuc ), but I wanted to fix the old one. Buy & save with cashback - http://ali.pub/2v0znm

Links to used tools:

  • NOGA deburring tool and Blades - http://ali.pub/2z2ah5

My favorites:

Thank you for every tip or donation,
it means great recognition for me and helps a lot to keep going!

name: Solder paste and flux Dispenser
description:
Solder paste and flux Dispenser

I liked the idea of this author https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:3137757, but I decided to do it my way. The case is easier to print with halves, which can then be glued together. But if you want to print it right away, I added the case full. Build details on video


An additional set of model components is provided in the project archive (Update 2019.09.zip). The tolerances of the gaps between the parts have been changed. I create models for further processing, but many people like printing only, corrections have been made.

Magnet Holder for Dispenser - https://www.thingiverse.com/thing:3889917

Parts links below:

  • Neodymium Magnets 10x4mm - http://ali.pub/3rq4v8
  • Luer Lock Adapter - http://ali.pub/3u4a3l
  • Syringe Barrel - http://ali.pub/3u41s5
  • Syringes Storage Cap - http://ali.pub/3u41tp
  • Steel Dispensing Needles Tips - http://ali.pub/3u41ua
  • Dispensing Needles - http://ali.pub/3u41vu

My favorites:

Thank you for every tip or donation,
it means great recognition for me and helps a lot to keep going!

name: Stencil Printer
description:
Stencil Printer

All details of the manufacture and use - see the video. Unfortunately the video did not work short :)

Source files here https://grabcad.com/library/stencil-printer-2

Materials used:

  • Aluminum Extrusion Profile 20x20 mm - http://ali.pub/34cu8s
  • Aluminum corner 20x20 mm - http://ali.pub/34cujo
  • Profile end cap 2020 mm - http://ali.pub/34cupb
  • T-Fastener Sliding Nut M3/M5 - http://ali.pub/34cute
  • Aluminium Tube Pipe 10x10x1 mm - http://ali.pub/34cuy2
  • Aluminium solid round bar rod 5mm - http://ali.pub/34cv1r
  • Lubricating Bearing Bushing 4x6x10 mm - http://ali.pub/34cv68
  • Cylindrical position pins 4x30 mm - http://ali.pub/34cvba
  • Galvanized iron sheet 0.8 mm - ???
  • Springs - http://ali.pub/34cvee
  • Screws/washers М3/M5 - http://ali.pub/34cvlz
  • Set screws - http://ali.pub/34dg8r
  • Insert Nuts M3 - http://ali.pub/34cvop
  • Thread Bar M3 - http://ali.pub/34cvu5
  • Thread Bar Brass M3 - http://ali.pub/34cykq
  • Strong Round Magnets 10X3 mm http://ali.pub/34cw2p
  • Rubber feet 13x10x7 mm - http://ali.pub/34cw8q
  • Glue B-7000 - http://ali.pub/34cwlr
  • Double-sided Transparent Clear Adhesive Tape 50M 5MM - http://ali.pub/34cwsy

Tools that helped to complete the project:

  • NOGA deburring tool and Blades - http://ali.pub/2z2ah5

name: Portable Magnetic Stirrer
description:
Portable Magnetic Stirrer

Motor from some DVD drive. The link ( https://goo.gl/qr948s ) is very similar, but the dimensions of the motor are not indicated there. Its dimensions are also shown in the video at the very beginning... ... Build details on video.

Links to used components:

  • Low Voltage DC Motor Speed Controller - http://ali.pub/2z2nad
  • 17500 Battery - http://ali.pub/2z2kn3
  • Lithium Battery Charger Module - http://ali.pub/2z2kq0)
  • Bearing 8x14x4] - http://ali.pub/2z2ngz
  • Magnetic Stiring rod - http://ali.pub/2z2nm1
  • Magnets 10 x 3 mm - http://ali.pub/42q119

name: Vibratory Washing Machine
description:
Vibratory Washing Machine

Sometimes I have to wash only one or a few small radio components, while the consumption of spirit using a large ultrasonic machine is large. Therefore, I created a small vibrating machine.

Motor with a diameter of 6 mm. All the details on the video.

Links to used components:

Vibration Motor - http://ali.pub/2z2mas Switch Button - http://ali.pub/2z2mev 1/2 AA Battery - http://ali.pub/2z2mm2

name: Rotary Tumbler
description:
Rotary Tumbler

Sketch for arduino in the archive. But this is an alpha version, it has several flaws, but in general it works. The controller controls the engine by changing the rotation every minute in one direction and then in another. Timer up to 24 hours. Can also be used without a controller. Build details on video.

Links to used components:

  • Arduino Pro Mini - http://ali.pub/2z2kdd
  • Bearing 625ZZ - http://ali.pub/2z2mu8
  • Oled - http://ali.pub/2z2n27
  • DRV L293D - http://ali.pub/2z2n5w

My favorites:

Thank you for every tip or donation,
it means great recognition for me and helps a lot to keep going!

name: Clamp for vertical use. Photo and video shooting
description:
Clamp for vertical use

The clamp is suitable for use by small cameras like Hero or Yi 4k + and other similar ones. You can also use smartphones for shooting.

The clamp can be mounted on the shelf or edge of the table. Using the ball head - the viewing angle is not limited. Also suitable for other devices for installing cameras.

I used tubes with a diameter of 8 mm, a wall thickness of 1 mm. Anodized aluminum. Threaded stud - M5 length 110 mm. Rubber substrate can be printed with soft filaments.

Some parts have to be glued together, but I'm sure you can do it :) In principle, it was possible to make clamps and thinner, but I was reinsured and made a margin of safety. In the video, I showed the stages of assembly of some parts.

For the options of suitable ball heads, see below:

Parts links below:

  • Mini Ball Head - http://ali.pub/3vd0kp
  • More Mini Ball Heads - http://ali.pub/3vd0z3

My favorites:

Thank you for every tip or donation,
it means great recognition for me and helps a lot to keep going!

name: Rotary table for painting
description:
Rotary table for painting

The table can be used both for painting small 3D models, and for demonstration photography or video shooting.

Links to used components:

  • Arduino Pro mini - http://ali.pub/2z2kdd
  • MINI ULN2003 - http://ali.pub/2z2kh2
  • DC-DC 2V-5V to 5V - http://ali.pub/2z2kje
  • 17500 Battery - http://ali.pub/2z2kn3
  • Lithium Battery Charger Module - http://ali.pub/2z2kq0
  • Potentiometer 50K - http://ali.pub/2z2ks5
  • Switch - http://ali.pub/2z2kw8)
  • Motor 28BYJ-48 - http://ali.pub/2z2l4z)
  • NL8H Ball Transfer Unit - http://ali.pub/2z2lc6)
  • Push Button - http://ali.pub/2z2lkq)

Code for Arduino will be in the archive, which you download.

My favorites:

Thank you for every tip or donation,
it means great recognition for me and helps a lot to keep going!
